paper_title.ja: 子どもの豊かな表現を引き出す保育者の態度Ⅱ
paper_title.en: Teacher's Attitude and its Effect in Bringing out the Multitudes of Expression by the Children II

description.ja: 子どもの豊かな表現を引き出す保育者の態度について, その現状と理想についてアンケート調査を行った。その結果, 次のような結果が得られた。(1) 保育者の現状について 「子どもの名前を覚える」, 「子どもの達成を認める」, 「子どもの発想を大切にする」など, 子どもに対する対応を行っている。 (2) 保育者が理想とする態度について 「子どもと共感する」など, 保育者と子どもの心に響き合うカテゴリが上位にきている。 (3) 幼児の表現を引き出す保育者の態度についての理想と現状の差について 理想と現状の差が最も大きいのは, 「子どもの観察力を高める」であった。次には, 日常保育の中で保育者が常に心がけるカテゴリが続く。それらは「製作物を自由に使えるようにする」, 「感触を体験させる」などである。 (4) 要因別に見た理想と現状の差 「感覚の刺激」, 「製作物の取り扱い」, 「環境」が, 上位を占める。差が最も少ないのは「子どもの名前を覚える」, 「保育者が繰り返し示す」であり, 理想と考えることが最もよく実行されていることがわかる。As teachers' attitude greatly influences the variety of expression by the children, we issued a questionnaire on the resent condition and ideal model of their attitude in teaching and dealing with children. The result is as follows; (1) A.S.Q(Analysis of Status Quo) of teachers' attitude for children at school. The following common facts in teachers' responses to children are found : "Recognizing children's by name", "Admitting children's achievement by prasing" and "Responding to children's own opinion by knowing their intention including their background psychology and situation" (2) The ideal model of teachers' attitude to children in kindergarten and day nursery. "To sympathize with children", to harmonize with them in value by opening their mind emotionally and psychologically. (3) The gap between present condition and the ideal figure of teachers' attitude to draw out various expressions by children. "Promote to children's observation" was the most difference of the status quo and an ideal. Our research said that the biggest gaps between the present condition and the ideal figure of teachers' attitude is their attitude to draw out various expressions by children, especially in which they promote "children's ability to observe". As for as their attitude of daily care is concerned, we have the following fact of evidence in the gap between the present condition and the ideal figure: to promote "children's ability to create something for themselves" and to give them "chances to touch something which gives them meanings and imagination and disposition" (4) The gap between the status quo and the ideal model of teachers' attitude in the following factors. Though we have a lot of articles according to various factors of teachers' attitude. The following 3 articles are put on top priority: As a matter of facts, our research shows that what the status quo and the ideal model of teachers' attitude meet is to show "the examples as to how to play". This is the most ideal model of teachers' attitude to consider and to practice in the most schools.

paper_title.ja: ガリバー旅行記に学ぶ表現的行動
paper_title.en: Expressive Behavior Obtained through Reading "Gulliver's Travels"

description.ja: 本研究はスウィフトの『ガリバー旅行記』から身体の異化が体験する表現的行動を抽出し,身体表現を豊かにするヒントの手掛かりを探るものである。ガリバーの身体の大きさがもたらす心的感覚と表現について,大きい身体からの視点で見た場合の部分を抽出した。さらに,ガリバーの身体の小ささがもたらす心的感覚と表現では,小さい身体の視点で見た場合の様子,身体が小さい故の工夫と限界,大きいものに相対したときの不快感に触れる。3番目に大きな立場と小さな立場に急変したカルチャーショックがもたらす表現の違いを抽出した。その結果,『ガリバー旅行記』に学ぶ表現的行動については次の4つを考えた。(1)テンポのレベルからの探求 (2)音の強弱のレベルからの探索 (3)空間のレベルからの探求 (4)音の高低のレベルからの探索 (5)大きいレベルと小さいレベルからの転換時の探求をした。そして,以上を子どもの表現に生かす場合,テンポを変える,音の大小・高低,空間構成・人数,周囲の状況を表す,部分を拡大して表現する等して,子どもの身体表現活動を豊かにするためのヒントを得た。This study was obtained some keys for abundance in body expression through reading "Gulliver's Travels" written by Swift. Some expressive behaviors was extracted from the tale when Gulliver lived in Lilliput. When Gulliver lived in Brobdingnag he found some devices and the limit as a dwarf, and felt displeasure of giants. I considered 4 levels : level of tempo, dynamics and pitch, space, at transition period. And I obtained some clues for abundance in body expression. They are to change tempo, to change dynamics and pitch, to compose space, to play with many children, to express about an environment, to magnify one part etc.

paper_title.ja: 幼児におけるダンス模倣の過程について
paper_title.en: Observation on Process of Child's Dance Imitation

description.ja: 本研究は幼児がダンスを学習する際に,動きやリズムをどのような過程を経て模倣していくのかを調べたものである。今回はその第一歩として,模倣の要素を明確にするとともに,年齢的な変化を見た。2～5歳児48名のビデオを分析した結果は次のようである。1 ダンス模倣の要素をパターン・タイミング・動きとした。2 模倣得点は3～5歳は年齢と共に増し,2歳と3歳では差が少ない。3 動きはパターン・タイミングに先んじて模倣できる。4 模倣する過程により6つのタイプに分けられ,2歳と3歳,4歳と5歳は似たタイプであった。5 ダンスの模倣は真似る能力だけでなく,恥ずかしい等の他の条件がかかわるときがあり,それは3歳児において顕著であった。This paper is intended as an investigation of observation on process of child imitation when they learn dance. As a beginning, I examined three items constituting of dance imitation, and observed variation making good progress with aging. I examined 48 children from two to five years old by video camera. In brief main point are follows : 1 I decided three factors about dance imitation - Pattern・timing・moving -. 2 Children from three to five years old showed progress with age, but between two and three wan not found any difference. 3 Moving was learned first rather than pattern and timing. 4 Imitation was divided six types according to reaction process. 5 Children showed other attitudes with dance imitation, for example shame. It was conspicuous at three years old.
